Drupal 9.1.2

Installation tasks

  1. Choose language (done)
  2. Choose profile (done)
  3. Verify requirements (done)
  4. Set up database (active)
  5. Install site
  6. Configure site

Database configuration

Database type

MySQL, MariaDB, Percona Server, or equivalent settings

Advanced options
If more than one application will be sharing this database, a unique table name prefix – such as drupal_ – will prevent collisions.

SQLite settings

The absolute path to the file where Drupal data will be stored. This must be writable by the web server and should exist outside of the web root.
Advanced options
If more than one application will be sharing this database, a unique table name prefix – such as drupal_ – will prevent collisions.

PostgreSQL settings

Advanced options
If more than one application will be sharing this database, a unique table name prefix – such as drupal_ – will prevent collisions.
